title: snowpega
author: snowpega
content: According to the recent Survey it comes to know that cryptocurrency is the second most popular Investment in the France. This Report was published on 13 November. According to this survey, the second higher propensity among the youngsters is cryptocurrency investment with the ratio of 9.4%. The majority of the investors are men with the ratio of 64% and from these most of the investors are youngsters. Their age very between 36 to 50 Years. In this ratio 54% people holds crypto-assets. sourceThis Is probably a very good decision of young generation to adopt the cryptocurrency assets as part of investment. The propensity of cryptocurrency as an investment is increasing day by day. Well, i think those days are not so far when everybody will talk about "investment in cryptocurrency."

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I can see that the survey looks very legit. More than 8k people were surveyed, and the results are supposedly representative of the adult population, which I think it's probably true. I didn't know investing was such a popular thing in France, as 1 in 4 people invested in something, and that 9.4% is from the adult population of France, so we're talking about millions of crypto investors in France.I'm happy to see such great numbers in France, and it would be interesting to follow the dynamics in the future (does the percentage go up, down, stay the same).

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: The legitimacy of the survey says it all cryptocurrency is a young generational asset thus in my perspective it going to gain full maturity in the use case with the next generation behind us. I think those that assume they are coming late into bitcoin essentially needs to read this and contrast it to the next generation that will be adopting bitcoin what would be said of them if the people adopting today are complaining of arriving late.It's only an issue of time that cryptocurrency will surpasses real estate that's at that top of the chart with 10.7%. I am one of those bitcoin/crypto maximalist who undoubtedly believe that there's a bright future for bitcoin and it's users, keep hodling.

When you put the percentage into a raw number, I felt insignificant and surprised that millions of people are invested in crypto maybe because I am locked in this cage we call forum that I thought that this is all the people that are interested in crypto.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: I will not be surprised at this survey that cryptocurrency is the second after real estate. This is because the youngsters have seen the bright future of cryptocurrency especially bitcoin as a better investment which is worth to generate profit for them in the long run and it is very easy to get started. Cryptocurrency is embraced by the youths because it is a digital currency and the world is becoming more digitalized everyday by day. I believe that in time to come cryptocurrency will even have more investors than real estate because both the poor and the rich can invest in it, but real estate is only for the rich. This shoes that the cryptocurrency adoption is growing rapidly in France.

comments.author: Marvell1
comments.body: I would not be surprised by the results of this survey because if we conducted this survey with young people in all countries the results would not be much different. Even we ourselves can feel it in our own country. In my country, the majority of young people are investing in cryptocurrency, even first and second year students spend time investing in cryptocurrency. Life is getting harder and the need to make money is getting bigger and cryptocurrencies are attracting great attention when it comes to generating big profits. Therefore, it is obvious that young people invest in cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Abu-Naim
comments.body: Quote from: snowpega on November 16, 2023, 11:23:21 AMThis Is probably a very good decision of young generation to adopt the cryptocurrency assets as part of investment. The propensity of cryptocurrency as an investment is increasing day by day. Well, i think those days are not so far when everybody will talk about "investment in cryptocurrency." This is good statistics, and the percentage of the cryptocurrency investors is showing how interesting this generation about bitcoin and cryptocurrency.I hope most of them have knowledge and know the risks involves in cryptocurrency investment, because it is not a physical investment that will be seen and monitored physically.I hope they are not driven by FOMO, all in the name of making a way to have quick money since so many people are saying that cryptocurrency investment can earn you money quick.Altcoins are not reliable, I wish they invested most of their money in Bitcoin instead of altcoin that may fail anytime.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: It's encouraging for sure! Especially in the world where multiple countries are still confused about cryptocurrency, France is showing the way. I wonder if the other countries will consider having a legal framework around Bitcoin. It will not only help the government to get more taxes but also open new ways for job creation. The benefits are multifold. The issue with not having a legal framework is that the scammers become active in this space and misguide people in the name of cryptocurrency investment.

comments.author: hyudien
comments.body: On the positive side, this is the beginning of an era where people are aware of what they are investing in. But it is important to note that some investors who decide to invest in crypto with all its risks require the younger generation in France to become more aware and more cautious. Not all types of cryptocurrencies are safe. But regardless, I believe that with the open-mindedness of young people, both in France and in any other country, they are now more aware of the existence of cryptocurrencies as a simple investment alternative, which does not require written requirements like investing in real estate. As for the dominance of Real Estate investment, it has always been the choice of the elderly because it is to support retirement.

The question is, how many respondents are there from the total population of France? I don't think 9% sums up the total number of French crypto investors, it's just the number of people interviewed.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: I think real estate will always be the primary investment that anyone could think, as young as 25, buying a house is already in their mind. But them adding crypto to their portfolio, it encourages the readers.What about the adoption of crypto in the country?This should be proportion to the survey result because it doesn't make sense when crypto is 2nd most popular investment yet the adoption is not at the local level where people can casually get coins from ATMs or use them to purchase something.

comments.author: arimamib
comments.body: Quote from: hyudien on November 16, 2023, 01:06:42 PMOn the positive side, this is the beginning of an era where people are aware of what they are investing in. But it is important to note that some investors who decide to invest in crypto with all its risks require the younger generation in France to become more aware and more cautious. Not all types of cryptocurrencies are safe. But regardless, I believe that with the open-mindedness of young people, both in France and in any other country, they are now more aware of the existence of cryptocurrencies as a simple investment alternative, which does not require written requirements like investing in real estate. As for the dominance of Real Estate investment, it has always been the choice of the elderly because it is to support retirement.Cryptocurrencies have widely discussed investment option, because their decentralized nature, and relative ease of access compared to traditional investment. The lack of stringent paperwork and regulatory requirements associated with cryptocurrency investments has also played a role, while real estate investment needs extensive documentation, legal processes, and background checks. Cryptocurrencies can be purchased and traded with minimal formalities. This has made them appealing to investors seeking a less complex and time-consuming investment experience.But cryptocurrencies still have inherent risks and uncertainties. Their volatile nature, susceptibility to scams and hacks, and lack of intrinsic value compared to traditional assets like real estate demand careful consideration before investing. Investors should conduct thorough research and understand the risks involved, and only invest funds they can afford to lose. I dont think it's a good choice of the elderly to support retirement.

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: Quote from: snowpega on November 16, 2023, 11:23:21 AMAccording to the recent Survey it comes to know that cryptocurrency is the second most popular Investment in the France.What I think from this result first is that the French are very keen and also informed on investment. When I read this and saw cryptocurrency as the second most popular, my interest was immediately raised to see the investment choice that was first. Real Estate is good too, but I think that if this survey is carried out again in a couple of months, cryptocurrency would have overtaken and become the first choice. If this survey is carried out in many other countries, it will give a different result.

comments.body: Quote from: snowpega on November 16, 2023, 11:23:21 AMAccording to the recent Survey it comes to know that cryptocurrency is the second most popular Investment in the France. This Report was published on 13 November.  ---This Is probably a very good decision of young generation to adopt the cryptocurrency assets as part of investment. The propensity of cryptocurrency as an investment is increasing day by day. Well, i think those days are not so far when everybody will talk about "investment in cryptocurrency." I haven't read the report (if there is an English version at all), but I wonder if it's good news that so many French people invest in cryptocurrencies, given that most of these investments are probably in altcoins, which are mostly pump&dump projects in which the invested money is very easily lost. I always say that I don't care what people do with their money (unless it hurts others around them), but I wonder how many of these people will find themselves in big financial problems in the future?Problems can only mean one thing for all of us, and that is the imposition of some crazy rules and regulations, so you don't need to look at those numbers with so much enthusiasm, because it all looks like a double-edged sword to me.

comments.body: I don't think anyone should be surprised about this, the older generation didn't leave anything but debt for the coming generation and Crypto is one place with level plain field that still exists in the world, to buy a house now is out of reach to many people but with a hundred Dollar and God helping you, you can turn this to $100k within a year or two, so why do you need to keep fuelling their rat race and not break free. I think the narrative is wrong and many are falling for the wrong coin to invest in.All investment involves risks and crypto-currency investment is not different and it has lots of risk with scam projects, bad Altcoins and ignorance from the part of the buyers, Crypto-currency investment would keep on growing but I hope we have more aware newbies to limit their vulnerability to bad investments.
